question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the largest negative integer $x$ satisfying $$24x \equiv 15 \pmod{1199}~?$$
inference:
Because $24$ and $1199$ are relatively prime, the equation has a unique solution modulo $1199$.
We can apply the Extended Euclidean Algorithm to the equation $24x+1199y=1$ to find the integer solution.

We have

$$\begin{split} 1199&=49\times24+19,\\ 24&=1\times19+5,\\ 19&=3\times5+4,\\ 5&=1\times4+1 \end{split}$$

Working backwards, we have

$$\begin{split} 1&=5-1\times4,\\ &=5-(19-3\times5)\times4,\\ &=4\times5-19\times4,\\ &=4\times(24-1\times19)-19\times4,\\ &=4\times24-19\times24,\\ &=4\times24-(1199-49\times24)\times24,\\ &=53\times24-1199\times24 \end{split}$$

Hence $53\times24\equiv1\pmod{1199}$. Therefore,

$$\begin{split} 24x&\equiv15\pmod{1199},\\\ 53\times24x&\equiv53\times15\pmod{1199},\\\ x&\equiv39\pmod{1199},\\\ x&=\boxed{-1160}. \end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{-1160}.$ I hope it is correct.
